column4: An account of the genealogy of Jesus the Messiah
column5: the son of David
column6: the son of Abraham.

column4: Abraham was the father of Isaac
column5: and Isaac the father of Jacob
column6: and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers

column4: and Judah the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar
column5: and Perez the father of Hezron
column6: and Hezron the father of Aram

column4: and Aram the father of Aminadab
column5: and Aminadab the father of Nahshon
column6: and Nahshon the father of Salmon

column4: and Salmon the father of Boaz by Rahab
column5: and Boaz the father of Obed by Ruth
column6: and Obed the father of Jesse

column4: and Jesse the father of King David. And David was the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah
and Solomon the father of Rehoboam
column5: and Rehoboam the father of Abijah
column6: and Abijah the father of Asaph

column4: and Asaph the father of Jehoshaphat
column5: and Jehoshaphat the father of Joram
column6: and Joram the father of Uzziah

column4: and Uzziah the father of Jotham
column5: and Jotham the father of Ahaz
column6: and Ahaz the father of Hezekiah

column4: and Hezekiah the father of Manasseh
column5: and Manasseh the father of Amos
column6: and Amos the father of Josiah

column4: and Josiah the father of Jechoniah and his brothers
column5: at the time of the deportation to Babylon.

column4: And after the deportation to Babylon: Jechoniah was the father of Salathiel
column5: and Salathiel the father of Zerubbabel

column4: and Zerubbabel the father of Abiud
column5: and Abiud the father of Eliakim
column6: and Eliakim the father of Azor

column4: and Azor the father of Zadok
column5: and Zadok the father of Achim
column6: and Achim the father of Eliud

column4: and Eliud the father of Eleazar
column5: and Eleazar the father of Matthan
column6: and Matthan the father of Jacob

column4: and Jacob the father of Joseph the husband of Mary
column5: of whom Jesus was born
column6: who is called the Messiah.

column4: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David to the deportation to Babylon
column5: fourteen generations; and from the deportation to Babylon to the Messiah
column6: fourteen generations.

column4: Now the birth of Jesus the Messiah took place in this way. When his mother Mary had been engaged to Joseph
column5: but before they lived together
column6: she was found to be with child from the Holy Spirit.

column4: Her husband Joseph
column5: being a righteous man and unwilling to expose her to public disgrace
column6: planned to dismiss her quietly.

column4: But just when he had resolved to do this
column5: an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said
column6: "Joseph
column7: son of David
column8: do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife
column9: for the child conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.

column4: She will bear a son
column5: and you are to name him Jesus
column6: for he will save his people from their sins."

column4: All this took place to fulfill what had been spoken by the Lord through the prophet:
"Look
column5: the virgin shall conceive and bear a son
column6: and they shall name him Emmanuel
column7: which means, God is with us."

column4: When Joseph awoke from sleep
column5: he did as the angel of the Lord commanded him; he took her as his wife

column4: but had no marital relations with her until she had borne a son; and he named him Jesus.
In the time of King Herod
column5: after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea
column6: wise men from the East came to Jerusalem

column4: asking
column5: "Where is the child who has been born king of the Jews? For we observed his star at its rising
column6: and have come to pay him homage."

column4: When King Herod heard this
column5: he was frightened
column6: and all Jerusalem with him;

column4: and calling together all the chief priests and scribes of the people
column5: he inquired of them where the Messiah was to be born.

column4: They told him
column5: "In Bethlehem of Judea; for so it has been written by the prophet:

column4: 'And you
column5: Bethlehem
column6: in the land of Judah
column7: are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you shall come a ruler who is to shepherd my people Israel.'"

column4: Then Herod secretly called for the wise men and learned from them the exact time when the star had appeared.
Then he sent them to Bethlehem
column5: saying
column6: "Go and search diligently for the child; and when you have found him
column7: bring me word so that I may also go and pay him homage."

column4: When they had heard the king
column5: they set out; and there
column6: ahead of them
column7: went the star that they had seen at its rising
column8: until it stopped over the place where the child was.

column4: When they saw that the star had stopped
column5: they were overwhelmed with joy.

column4: On entering the house
column5: they saw the child with Mary his mother; and they knelt down and paid him homage. Then
column6: opening their treasure chests
column7: they offered him gifts of gold

column4: And having been warned in a dream not to return to Herod
column5: they left for their own country by another road.

column4: Now after they had left
column5: an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said
column6: "Get up
column7: take the child and his mother
column9: and remain there until I tell you; for Herod is about to search for the child

column4: Then Joseph got up
column5: took the child and his mother by night
column6: and went to Egypt

column4: and remained there until the death of Herod. This was to fulfill what had been spoken by the Lord through the prophet
column5: "Out of Egypt I have called my son."

column4: When Herod saw that he had been tricked by the wise men
column5: he was infuriated

column7: according to the time that he had learned from the wise men.

column4: Then was fulfilled what had been spoken through the prophet Jeremiah:
"A voice was heard in Ramah

column4: When Herod died
column5: an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt and said

column4: "Get up
column5: take the child and his mother

column4: Then Joseph got up
column5: took the child and his mother

column6: "He will be called a Nazorean."

column4: In those days John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness of Judea

column4: Now John wore clothing of camel's hair with a leather belt around his waist

column4: Even now the ax is lying at the root of the trees; every tree therefore that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire.
"I baptize you with water for repentance

column4: "Blessed are you when people revile you and persecute you and utter all kinds of evil against you falsely on my account.
Rejoice and be glad
column5: for your reward is great in heaven

column4: "You are the salt of the earth; but if salt has lost its taste

No one after lighting a lamp puts it under the bushel basket

column4: "Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets; I have come not to abolish but to fulfill.
For truly I tell you

column4: Therefore
column5: whoever breaks one of the least of these commandments

column4: "You have heard that it was said to those of ancient times

column5: you will be liable to judgment; and if you insult a brother or sister

column7: 'You fool

column4: So when you are offering your gift at the altar

column5: and then come and offer your gift.

column4: Come to terms quickly with your accuser while you are on the way to court with him
column5: or your accuser may hand you over to the judge
column6: and the judge to the guard
column7: and you will be thrown into prison.

column4: Truly I tell you
column5: you will never get out until you have paid the last penny.

column4: "You have heard that it was said
column5: 'You shall not commit adultery.'

column4: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman with lust has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
If your right eye causes you to sin
column5: tear it out and throw it away; it is better for you to lose one of your members than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.

column4: And if your right hand causes you to sin
column5: cut it off and throw it away; it is better for you to lose one of your members than for your whole body to go into hell.

column4: "It was also said
column5: 'Whoever divorces his wife
column6: let him give her a certificate of divorce.'

column4: But I say to you that anyone who divorces his wife

column4: "Again
column5: you have heard that it was said to those of ancient times

column4: But I say to you
column5: Do not swear at all
column6: either by heaven

column4: or by the earth
column5: for it is his footstool
column6: or by Jerusalem
column7: for it is the city of the great King.

column4: And do not swear by your head
column5: for you cannot make one hair white or black.

column4: Let your word be 'Yes
column5: Yes' or 'No
column6: No'; anything more than this comes from the evil one.

column4: "You have heard that it was said
column5: 'An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.'

column4: But I say to you
column5: Do not resist an evildoer. But if anyone strikes you on the right cheek
column6: turn the other also;

column4: and if anyone wants to sue you and take your coat

column4: and if anyone forces you to go one mile
column5: go also the second mile.

column4: Give to everyone who begs from you

column4: "You have heard that it was said

column4: For if you love those who love you

column4: And if you greet only your brothers and sisters
column5: what more are you doing than others? Do not even the Gentiles do the same?

column4: Be perfect
column5: therefore
column6: as your heavenly Father is perfect.

column4: "Beware of practicing your piety before others in order to be seen by them; for then you have no reward from your Father in heaven.
"So whenever you give alms
column5: do not sound a trumpet before you
column6: as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets
column7: so that they may be praised by others. Truly I tell you

column4: But when you give alms

"And whenever you pray
column5: do not be like the hypocrites; for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and at the street corners

column4: But whenever you pray

column4: "When you are praying

column4: "Pray then in this way: Our Father in heaven

"Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth

column4: but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven

column4: "The eye is the lamp of the body. So

column4: "No one can serve two masters; for a slave will either hate the one and love the other

column4: "Therefore I tell you

column4: Look at the birds of the air; they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns

column4: Therefore do not worry

column4: "Do not judge

column4: "Do not give what is holy to dogs; and do not throw your pearls before swine

column4: "Ask

column4: "No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old cloak; otherwise

column4: Now when the Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem gathered around him

column5: that is
column6: without washing them.

column5: and all the Jews
column6: do not eat unless they thoroughly wash their hands

column4: So the Pharisees and the scribes asked him

Then he said to them

column5: 'Honor your father and your mother'; and
column6: 'Whoever speaks evil of father or mother must surely die.'

column4: But you say that if anyone tells father or mother
column5: 'Whatever support you might have had from me is Corban' (that is
column6: an offering to God)--

column4: then you no longer permit doing anything for a father or mother
thus making void the word of God through your tradition that you have handed on. And you do many things like this."
Then he called the crowd again and said to them
column5: "Listen to me
column6: all of you
column7: and understand:

column4: there is nothing outside a person that by going in can defile
column5: but the things that come out are what defile."

column4: When he had left the crowd and entered the house
column5: his disciples asked him about the parable.

column4: since it enters
column5: not the heart but the stomach

column4: And he said
column5: "It is what comes out of a person that defiles.

column4: For it is from within
column5: from the human heart
column6: that evil intentions come: fornication
column7: theft

column4: adultery
column5: avarice
column6: wickedness
column7: deceit

column4: For nothing will be impossible with God."

column4: In those days a decree went out from Emperor Augustus that all the world should be registered.

column4: He was in the beginning with God.
All things came into being through him
column5: and without him not one thing came into being. What has come into being

column4: in him was life
column5: and the life was the light of all people.

column4: The light shines in the darkness
column5: and the darkness did not overcome it.

column4: There was a man sent from God
column5: whose name was John.

column4: He came as a witness to testify to the light
column5: so that all might believe through him.

column4: He himself was not the light
column5: but he came to testify to the light.

column4: The true light
column5: which enlightens everyone
column6: was coming into the world.

column4: He was in the world
column5: and the world came into being through him; yet the world did not know him.

column4: He came to what was his own
column5: and his own people did not accept him.

column4: But to all who received him
column5: who believed in his name
column6: he gave power to become children of God

column4: who were born
column5: not of blood or of the will of the flesh or of the will of man
column6: but of God.

column4: And the Word became flesh and lived among us
column5: and we have seen his glory
column6: the glory as of a father's only son
column7: full of grace and truth.

column4: (John testified to him and cried out
column5: "This was he of whom I said
column6: 'He who comes after me ranks ahead of me because he was before me.'")

column4: From his fullness we have all received
column5: grace upon grace.

column4: The law indeed was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
No one has ever seen God. It is God the only Son
column5: who is close to the Father's heart
column6: who has made him known.

column4: This is the testimony given by John when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him
column5: "Who are you?"

column4: He confessed and did not deny it
column5: but confessed
column6: "I am not the Messiah."

column4: And they asked him
column5: "What then? Are you Elijah?" He said
column6: "I am not." "Are you the prophet?" He answered
column7: "No."

column4: Then they said to him
column5: "Who are you? Let us have an answer for those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?"

column4: He said
column5: "I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness
column6: 'Make straight the way of the Lord
column7: '" as the prophet Isaiah said.

column4: Now they had been sent from the Pharisees.
They asked him
column5: "Why then are you baptizing if you are neither the Messiah
column6: nor Elijah
column7: nor the prophet?"

column4: John answered them
column5: "I baptize with water. Among you stands one whom you do not know

column4: the one who is coming after me; I am not worthy to untie the thong of his sandal."
This took place in Bethany across the Jordan where John was baptizing.
The next day he saw Jesus coming toward him and declared
column5: "Here is the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!

column4: This is he of whom I said
column5: 'After me comes a man who ranks ahead of me because he was before me.'

column4: I myself did not know him; but I came baptizing with water for this reason
column5: that he might be revealed to Israel."

column4: And John testified
column5: "I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove
column6: and it remained on him.

column4: I myself did not know him
column5: but the one who sent me to baptize with water said to me
column6: 'He on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.'

column4: And I myself have seen and have testified that this is the Son of God."
The next day John again was standing with two of his disciples
and as he watched Jesus walk by
column5: he exclaimed
column6: "Look
column7: here is the Lamb of God!"

column4: The two disciples heard him say this
column5: and they followed Jesus.

column4: When Jesus turned and saw them following
column5: he said to them
column6: "What are you looking for?" They said to him
column7: "Rabbi" (which translated means Teacher)

column4: He said to them
column5: "Come and see." They came and saw where he was staying
column6: and they remained with him that day. It was about four o'clock in the afternoon.

column4: One of the two who heard John speak and followed him was Andrew
column5: Simon Peter's brother.

column4: He first found his brother Simon and said to him
column5: "We have found the Messiah" (which is translated Anointed).

column4: He brought Simon to Jesus
column5: who looked at him and said
column6: "You are Simon son of John. You are to be called Cephas" (which is translated Peter).

column4: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him
column5: "Follow me."

column4: Now Philip was from Bethsaida
column5: the city of Andrew and Peter.

column4: Philip found Nathanael and said to him
column5: "We have found him about whom Moses in the law and also the prophets wrote
column6: Jesus son of Joseph from Nazareth."

column4: Nathanael said to him
column5: "Can anything good come out of Nazareth?" Philip said to him
column6: "Come and see."

column4: When Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him
column5: he said of him
column6: "Here is truly an Israelite in whom there is no deceit!"

column4: Nathanael asked him
column5: "Where did you get to know me?" Jesus answered
column6: "I saw you under the fig tree before Philip called you."

column4: Nathanael replied
column5: "Rabbi
column6: you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!"

column4: Jesus answered
column5: "Do you believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than these."

column4: And he said to him
column5: "Very truly
column6: I tell you
column7: you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man."

column4: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee
column5: and the mother of Jesus was there.

column4: Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.
When the wine gave out
column5: the mother of Jesus said to him
column6: "They have no wine."

column4: And Jesus said to her
column5: "Woman
column6: what concern is that to you and to me? My hour has not yet come."

column4: His mother said to the servants
column5: "Do whatever he tells you."

column4: Now standing there were six stone water jars for the Jewish rites of purification
column5: each holding twenty or thirty gallons.

column4: Jesus said to them
column5: "Fill the jars with water." And they filled them up to the brim.

column4: He said to them
column5: "Now draw some out
column6: and take it to the chief steward." So they took it.

column4: When the steward tasted the water that had become wine
column5: and did not know where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew)
column6: the steward called the bridegroom

column4: and said to him
column5: "Everyone serves the good wine first
column6: and then the inferior wine after the guests have become drunk. But you have kept the good wine until now."

column4: Jesus did this
column5: the first of his signs
column6: in Cana of Galilee
column7: and revealed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.

column4: After this he went down to Capernaum with his mother
column5: his brothers
column6: and his disciples; and they remained there a few days.

column4: The Passover of the Jews was near
column5: and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

column4: In the temple he found people selling cattle
column5: sheep
column6: and doves
column7: and the money changers seated at their tables.

column4: Making a whip of cords
column5: he drove all of them out of the temple
column6: both the sheep and the cattle. He also poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.

column4: He told those who were selling the doves
column5: "Take these things out of here! Stop making my Father's house a marketplace!"

column4: His disciples remembered that it was written
column5: "Zeal for your house will consume me."

column4: The Jews then said to him
column5: "What sign can you show us for doing this?"

column4: Jesus answered them
column5: "Destroy this temple
column6: and in three days I will raise it up."

column4: The Jews then said
column5: "This temple has been under construction for forty-six years
column6: and will you raise it up in three days?"

column4: But he was speaking of the temple of his body.
After he was raised from the dead
column5: his disciples remembered that he had said this; and they believed the scripture and the word that Jesus had spoken.

column4: When he was in Jerusalem during the Passover festival
column5: many believed in his name because they saw the signs that he was doing.

column4: But Jesus on his part would not entrust himself to them
column5: because he knew all people

column4: and needed no one to testify about anyone; for he himself knew what was in everyone.
Now there was a Pharisee named Nicodemus
column5: a leader of the Jews.

column4: He came to Jesus by night and said to him
column5: "Rabbi
column6: we know that you are a teacher who has come from God; for no one can do these signs that you do apart from the presence of God."

column4: Jesus answered him
column5: "Very truly
column6: I tell you
column7: no one can see the kingdom of God without being born from above."

column4: Nicodemus said to him
column5: "How can anyone be born after having grown old? Can one enter a second time into the mother's womb and be born?"

column4: Jesus answered
column5: "Very truly
column6: I tell you
column7: no one can enter the kingdom of God without being born of water and Spirit.

column4: What is born of the flesh is flesh
column5: and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.

column4: Do not be astonished that I said to you
column5: 'You must be born from above.'

column4: The wind blows where it chooses
column5: and you hear the sound of it
column6: but you do not know where it comes from or where it goes. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit."

column4: Nicodemus said to him
column5: "How can these things be?"

column4: Jesus answered him
column5: "Are you a teacher of Israel
column6: and yet you do not understand these things?

column4: "Very truly
column5: I tell you
column6: we speak of what we know and testify to what we have seen; yet you do not receive our testimony.

column4: If I have told you about earthly things and you do not believe
column5: how can you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?

column4: No one has ascended into heaven except the one who descended from heaven
column5: the Son of Man.

column4: And just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness
column5: so must the Son of Man be lifted up

column4: that whoever believes in him may have eternal life.
"For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son
column5: so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life.

column4: "Indeed
column5: God did not send the Son into the world to condemn the world
column6: but in order that the world might be saved through him.

column4: Those who believe in him are not condemned; but those who do not believe are condemned already
column5: because they have not believed in the name of the only Son of God.

column4: And this is the judgment
column5: that the light has come into the world
column6: and people loved darkness rather than light because their deeds were evil.

column4: For all who do evil hate the light and do not come to the light
column5: so that their deeds may not be exposed.

column4: But those who do what is true come to the light
column5: so that it may be clearly seen that their deeds have been done in God."

column4: After this Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside
column5: and he spent some time there with them and baptized.

column4: John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim because water was abundant there; and people kept coming and were being baptized
-- John
column5: of course
column6: had not yet been thrown into prison.

column4: Now a discussion about purification arose between John's disciples and a Jew.
They came to John and said to him
column5: "Rabbi
column6: the one who was with you across the Jordan
column7: to whom you testified
column9: and all are going to him."

column4: John answered
column5: "No one can receive anything except what has been given from heaven.

column4: You yourselves are my witnesses that I said
column5: 'I am not the Messiah
column6: but I have been sent ahead of him.'

column4: He who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend of the bridegroom
column5: who stands and hears him
column6: rejoices greatly at the bridegroom's voice. For this reason my joy has been fulfilled.

column4: He must increase
column5: but I must decrease."

column4: The one who comes from above is above all; the one who is of the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things. The one who comes from heaven is above all.
He testifies to what he has seen and heard
column5: yet no one accepts his testimony.

column4: Whoever has accepted his testimony has certified this
column5: that God is true.

column4: He whom God has sent speaks the words of God
column5: for he gives the Spirit without measure.

column4: The Father loves the Son and has placed all things in his hands.
Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life; whoever disobeys the Son will not see life
column5: but must endure God's wrath.

column4: Now when Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard
column5: "Jesus is making and baptizing more disciples than John"

column4: -- although it was not Jesus himself but his disciples who baptized--
he left Judea and started back to Galilee.
But he had to go through Samaria.
So he came to a Samaritan city called Sychar
column5: near the plot of ground that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.

column4: Jacob's well was there
column5: and Jesus
column6: tired out by his journey
column7: was sitting by the well. It was about noon.

column4: A Samaritan woman came to draw water
column5: and Jesus said to her
column6: "Give me a drink."

column4: (His disciples had gone to the city to buy food.)
The Samaritan woman said to him
column5: "How is it that you
column6: a Jew
column7: ask a drink of me
column8: a woman of Samaria?" (Jews do not share things in common with Samaritans.)

column4: Jesus answered her
column5: "If you knew the gift of God
column6: and who it is that is saying to you
column7: 'Give me a drink
column9: and he would have given you living water."

column4: The woman said to him
column5: "Sir
column6: you have no bucket
column7: and the well is deep. Where do you get that living water?

column4: Are you greater than our ancestor Jacob
column5: who gave us the well
column6: and with his sons and his flocks drank from it?"

column4: Jesus said to her
column5: "Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again

column4: but those who drink of the water that I will give them will never be thirsty. The water that I will give will become in them a spring of water gushing up to eternal life."
The woman said to him
column5: "Sir
column6: give me this water
column7: so that I may never be thirsty or have to keep coming here to draw water."

column4: Jesus said to her
column5: "Go
column6: call your husband
column7: and come back."

column4: The woman answered him
column5: "I have no husband." Jesus said to her
column6: "You are right in saying
column7: 'I have no husband';

column4: for you have had five husbands
column5: and the one you have now is not your husband. What you have said is true!"

column4: The woman said to him
column5: "Sir
column6: I see that you are a prophet.

column4: Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain
column5: but you say that the place where people must worship is in Jerusalem."

column4: Jesus said to her
column5: "Woman
column6: believe me
column7: the hour is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.

column4: You worship what you do not know; we worship what we know
column5: for salvation is from the Jews.

column4: But the hour is coming
column5: and is now here
column6: when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth
column7: for the Father seeks such as these to worship him.

column4: God is spirit
column5: and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth."

column4: The woman said to him
column5: "I know that Messiah is coming" (who is called Christ). "When he comes
column6: he will proclaim all things to us."

column4: Jesus said to her
column5: "I am he
column6: the one who is speaking to you."

column4: Just then his disciples came. They were astonished that he was speaking with a woman
column5: but no one said
column6: "What do you want?" or
column7: "Why are you speaking with her?"

column4: Then the woman left her water jar and went back to the city. She said to the people
"Come and see a man who told me everything I have ever done! He cannot be the Messiah
column5: can he?"

column4: They left the city and were on their way to him.
Meanwhile the disciples were urging him
column5: "Rabbi
column6: eat something."

column4: But he said to them
column5: "I have food to eat that you do not know about."

column4: So the disciples said to one another
column5: "Surely no one has brought him something to eat?"

column4: Jesus said to them
column5: "My food is to do the will of him who sent me and to complete his work.

column4: Do you not say
column5: 'Four months more
column6: then comes the harvest'? But I tell you
column7: look around you
column8: and see how the fields are ripe for harvesting.

column4: The reaper is already receiving wages and is gathering fruit for eternal life
column5: so that sower and reaper may rejoice together.

column4: For here the saying holds true
column5: 'One sows and another reaps.'

column4: I sent you to reap that for which you did not labor. Others have labored
column5: and you have entered into their labor."

column4: Many Samaritans from that city believed in him because of the woman's testimony
column5: "He told me everything I have ever done."

column4: So when the Samaritans came to him
column5: they asked him to stay with them; and he stayed there two days.

column4: And many more believed because of his word.
They said to the woman
column5: "It is no longer because of what you said that we believe
column6: for we have heard for ourselves
column7: and we know that this is truly the Savior of the world."

column4: When the two days were over
column5: he went from that place to Galilee

column4: (for Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in the prophet's own country).
When he came to Galilee
column5: the Galileans welcomed him
column6: since they had seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the festival; for they too had gone to the festival.

column4: Then he came again to Cana in Galilee where he had changed the water into wine. Now there was a royal official whose son lay ill in Capernaum.
When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee
column5: he went and begged him to come down and heal his son
column6: for he was at the point of death.

column4: Then Jesus said to him
column5: "Unless you see signs and wonders you will not believe."

column4: The official said to him
column5: "Sir
column6: come down before my little boy dies."

column4: Jesus said to him
column5: "Go; your son will live." The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and started on his way.

column4: As he was going down
column5: his slaves met him and told him that his child was alive.

column4: So he asked them the hour when he began to recover
column5: and they said to him
column6: "Yesterday at one in the afternoon the fever left him."

column4: The father realized that this was the hour when Jesus had said to him
column5: "Your son will live." So he himself believed
column6: along with his whole household.

column4: Now this was the second sign that Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.
After this there was a festival of the Jews
column5: and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

column4: Now in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate there is a pool
column5: called in Hebrew Beth-zatha
column6: which has five porticoes.

column4: In these lay many invalids-- blind
column5: lame
column6: and paralyzed.

column4: One man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there and knew that he had been there a long time
column5: he said to him
column6: "Do you want to be made well?"

column4: The sick man answered him
column5: "Sir
column6: I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up; and while I am making my way
column7: someone else steps down ahead of me."

column4: Jesus said to him
column5: "Stand up
column6: take your mat and walk."

column4: At once the man was made well
column5: and he took up his mat and began to walk. Now that day was a sabbath.

column4: So the Jews said to the man who had been cured
column5: "It is the sabbath; it is not lawful for you to carry your mat."

column4: But he answered them
column5: "The man who made me well said to me
column6: 'Take up your mat and walk.'"

column4: They asked him
column5: "Who is the man who said to you
column6: 'Take it up and walk'?"

column4: Now the man who had been healed did not know who it was
column5: for Jesus had disappeared in the crowd that was there.

column4: Later Jesus found him in the temple and said to him
column5: "See
column6: you have been made well! Do not sin any more
column7: so that nothing worse happens to you."

column4: The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
Therefore the Jews started persecuting Jesus
column5: because he was doing such things on the sabbath.

column4: But Jesus answered them
column5: "My Father is still working
column6: and I also am working."

column4: For this reason the Jews were seeking all the more to kill him
column5: because he was not only breaking the sabbath
column6: but was also calling God his own Father
column7: thereby making himself equal to God.

column4: Jesus said to them
column5: "Very truly
column6: I tell you
column7: the Son can do nothing on his own
column8: but only what he sees the Father doing; for whatever the Father does

column4: The Father loves the Son and shows him all that he himself is doing; and he will show him greater works than these
column5: so that you will be astonished.

column4: Indeed
column5: just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life
column6: so also the Son gives life to whomever he wishes.

column4: The Father judges no one but has given all judgment to the Son
so that all may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Anyone who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
Very truly
column5: I tell you
column6: anyone who hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life
column7: and does not come under judgment
column8: but has passed from death to life.

column4: "Very truly
column5: I tell you
column6: the hour is coming
column7: and is now here
column8: when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God
column9: and those who hear will live.

column4: For just as the Father has life in himself
column5: so he has granted the Son also to have life in himself;

column4: and he has given him authority to execute judgment
column5: because he is the Son of Man.

column4: Do not be astonished at this; for the hour is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice
and will come out-- those who have done good
column5: to the resurrection of life
column6: and those who have done evil
column7: to the resurrection of condemnation.

column4: "I can do nothing on my own. As I hear
column5: I judge; and my judgment is just
column6: because I seek to do not my own will but the will of him who sent me.

column4: "If I testify about myself
column5: my testimony is not true.

column4: There is another who testifies on my behalf
column5: and I know that his testimony to me is true.

column4: You sent messengers to John
column5: and he testified to the truth.

column4: Not that I accept such human testimony
column5: but I say these things so that you may be saved.

column4: He was a burning and shining lamp
column5: and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.

column4: But I have a testimony greater than John's. The works that the Father has given me to complete
column5: the very works that I am doing
column6: testify on my behalf that the Father has sent me.

column4: And the Father who sent me has himself testified on my behalf. You have never heard his voice or seen his form
and you do not have his word abiding in you
column5: because you do not believe him whom he has sent.

column4: "You search the scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life; and it is they that testify on my behalf.
Yet you refuse to come to me to have life.
I do not accept glory from human beings.
But I know that you do not have the love of God in you.
I have come in my Father's name
column5: and you do not accept me; if another comes in his own name
column6: you will accept him.

column4: How can you believe when you accept glory from one another and do not seek the glory that comes from the one who alone is God?
Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father; your accuser is Moses
column5: on whom you have set your hope.

column4: If you believed Moses
column5: you would believe me
column6: for he wrote about me.

column4: But if you do not believe what he wrote
column5: how will you believe what I say?"

column4: After this Jesus went to the other side of the Sea of Galilee
column5: also called the Sea of Tiberias.

column4: A large crowd kept following him
column5: because they saw the signs that he was doing for the sick.

column4: Jesus went up the mountain and sat down there with his disciples.
Now the Passover
column5: the festival of the Jews
column6: was near.

column4: When he looked up and saw a large crowd coming toward him
column5: Jesus said to Philip
column6: "Where are we to buy bread for these people to eat?"

column4: He said this to test him
column5: for he himself knew what he was going to do.

column4: Philip answered him
column5: "Six months' wages would not buy enough bread for each of them to get a little."

column4: One of his disciples
column5: Andrew
column6: Simon Peter's brother
column7: said to him

column4: "There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish. But what are they among so many people?"
Jesus said
column5: "Make the people sit down." Now there was a great deal of grass in the place; so they sat down
column6: about five thousand in all.

column4: Then Jesus took the loaves
column5: and when he had given thanks
column6: he distributed them to those who were seated; so also the fish
column7: as much as they wanted.

column4: When they were satisfied
column5: he told his disciples
column6: "Gather up the fragments left over
column7: so that nothing may be lost."

column4: So they gathered them up
column5: and from the fragments of the five barley loaves
column6: left by those who had eaten
column7: they filled twelve baskets.

column4: When the people saw the sign that he had done
column5: they began to say
column6: "This is indeed the prophet who is to come into the world."

column4: When Jesus realized that they were about to come and take him by force to make him king
column5: he withdrew again to the mountain by himself.

column4: When evening came
column5: his disciples went down to the sea

column4: got into a boat
column5: and started across the sea to Capernaum. It was now dark
column6: and Jesus had not yet come to them.

column4: The sea became rough because a strong wind was blowing.
When they had rowed about three or four miles
column5: they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat
column6: and they were terrified.

column4: But he said to them
column5: "It is I; do not be afraid."

column4: Then they wanted to take him into the boat
column5: and immediately the boat reached the land toward which they were going.

column4: The next day the crowd that had stayed on the other side of the sea saw that there had been only one boat there. They also saw that Jesus had not got into the boat with his disciples
column5: but that his disciples had gone away alone.

column4: Then some boats from Tiberias came near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
So when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there
column5: they themselves got into the boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.

column4: When they found him on the other side of the sea
column5: they said to him
column6: "Rabbi
column7: when did you come here?"

column4: Jesus answered them
column5: "Very truly
column6: I tell you
column7: you are looking for me
column9: but because you ate your fill of the loaves.

column5: 'God will raise up a prophet for you from your own people as he raised me up.'

column4: He is the one who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him at Mount Sinai
column5: and with our ancestors; and he received living oracles to give to us.

column4: Our ancestors were unwilling to obey him; instead
column5: they pushed him aside
column6: and in their hearts they turned back to Egypt

column4: saying to Aaron
column5: 'Make gods for us who will lead the way for us; as for this Moses who led us out from the land of Egypt
column6: we do not know what has happened to him.'

column4: At that time they made a calf
column5: offered a sacrifice to the idol
column6: and reveled in the works of their hands.

column4: But God turned away from them and handed them over to worship the host of heaven
column5: as it is written in the book of the prophets: 'Did you offer to me slain victims and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness
column6: O house of Israel?

column4: No; you took along the tent of Moloch
column5: and the star of your god Rephan
column6: the images that you made to worship; so I will remove you beyond Babylon.'

column4: "Our ancestors had the tent of testimony in the wilderness
column5: as God directed when he spoke to Moses
column6: ordering him to make it according to the pattern he had seen.

column4: Our ancestors in turn brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations that God drove out before our ancestors. And it was there until the time of David
who found favor with God and asked that he might find a dwelling place for the house of Jacob.
But it was Solomon who built a house for him.
Yet the Most High does not dwell in houses made with human hands; as the prophet says
'Heaven is my throne
column5: and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house will you build for me
column6: says the Lord
column7: or what is the place of my rest?

column4: Did not my hand make all these things?'
"You stiff-necked people
column5: uncircumcised in heart and ears
column6: you are forever opposing the Holy Spirit
column7: just as your ancestors used to do.

column4: Which of the prophets did your ancestors not persecute? They killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One
column5: and now you have become his betrayers and murderers.

column4: You are the ones that received the law as ordained by angels
column5: and yet you have not kept it."

column4: When they heard these things
column5: they became enraged and ground their teeth at Stephen.

column4: But filled with the Holy Spirit
column5: he gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

column4: "Look
column5: he said, I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!"

column4: But they covered their ears
column5: and with a loud shout all rushed together against him.

column4: Then they dragged him out of the city and began to stone him; and the witnesses laid their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.
While they were stoning Stephen
column5: he prayed
column6: "Lord Jesus
column7: receive my spirit."

column4: Then he knelt down and cried out in a loud voice
column5: "Lord
column6: do not hold this sin against them." When he had said this
column7: he died.

column4: And Saul approved of their killing him. That day a severe persecution began against the church in Jerusalem
column5: and all except the apostles were scattered throughout the countryside of Judea and Samaria.

column4: Devout men buried Stephen and made loud lamentation over him.
But Saul was ravaging the church by entering house after house; dragging off both men and women
column5: he committed them to prison.

column4: Now those who were scattered went from place to place
column5: proclaiming the word.

column4: Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah to them.
The crowds with one accord listened eagerly to what was said by Philip
column5: hearing and seeing the signs that he did

column4: for unclean spirits
column5: crying with loud shrieks
column6: came out of many who were possessed; and many others who were paralyzed or lame were cured.

column4: So there was great joy in that city.
Now a certain man named Simon had previously practiced magic in the city and amazed the people of Samaria
column5: saying that he was someone great.

column4: All of them
column5: from the least to the greatest
column6: listened to him eagerly
column7: saying
column8: "This man is the power of God that is called Great."

column4: And they listened eagerly to him because for a long time he had amazed them with his magic.
But when they believed Philip
column5: who was proclaiming the good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ
column6: they were baptized
column7: both men and women.

column4: Even Simon himself believed. After being baptized
column5: he stayed constantly with Philip and was amazed when he saw the signs and great miracles that took place.

column4: Now when the apostles at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God
column5: they sent Peter and John to them.

column4: The two went down and prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit
(for as yet the Spirit had not come upon any of them; they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus).
Then Peter and John laid their hands on them
column5: and they received the Holy Spirit.

column4: Now when Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles' hands
column5: he offered them money

column4: saying
column5: "Give me also this power so that anyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit."

column4: But Peter said to him
column5: "May your silver perish with you
column6: because you thought you could obtain God's gift with money!

column4: You have no part or share in this
column5: for your heart is not right before God.

column4: Repent therefore of this wickedness of yours
column5: and pray to the Lord that
column6: if possible
column7: the intent of your heart may be forgiven you.

column4: For I see that you are in the gall of bitterness and the chains of wickedness."
Simon answered
column5: "Pray for me to the Lord
column6: that nothing of what you have said may happen to me."

column4: Now after Peter and John had testified and spoken the word of the Lord
column5: they returned to Jerusalem
column6: proclaiming the good news to many villages of the Samaritans.

column4: Then an angel of the Lord said to Philip
column5: "Get up and go toward the south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza." (This is a wilderness road.)

column4: So he got up and went. Now there was an Ethiopian eunuch
column5: a court official of the Candace
column6: queen of the Ethiopians
column7: in charge of her entire treasury. He had come to Jerusalem to worship

column4: and was returning home; seated in his chariot
column5: he was reading the prophet Isaiah.

column4: Then the Spirit said to Philip
column5: "Go over to this chariot and join it."

column4: So Philip ran up to it and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah. He asked
column5: "Do you understand what you are reading?"

column4: He replied
column5: "How can I
column6: unless someone guides me?" And he invited Philip to get in and sit beside him.

column4: Now the passage of the scripture that he was reading was this: "Like a sheep he was led to the slaughter
column5: and like a lamb silent before its shearer
column6: so he does not open his mouth.

column4: In his humiliation justice was denied him. Who can describe his generation? For his life is taken away from the earth."
The eunuch asked Philip
column5: "About whom
column6: may I ask you
column7: does the prophet say this
column8: about himself or about someone else?"

column4: Then Philip began to speak
column5: and starting with this scripture
column6: he proclaimed to him the good news about Jesus.

column4: As they were going along the road
column5: they came to some water; and the eunuch said
column6: "Look
column7: here is water! What is to prevent me from being baptized?"

column4: He commanded the chariot to stop
column5: and both of them
column6: Philip and the eunuch
column7: went down into the water

column4: When they came up out of the water
column5: the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away; the eunuch saw him no more
column6: and went on his way rejoicing.

column4: But Philip found himself at Azotus
column5: and as he was passing through the region
column6: he proclaimed the good news to all the towns until he came to Caesarea.

column4: Meanwhile Saul
column5: still breathing threats and murder against the disciples of the Lord
column6: went to the high priest

column4: and asked him for letters to the synagogues at Damascus
column5: so that if he found any who belonged to the Way
column6: men or women
column7: he might bring them bound to Jerusalem.

column4: Now as he was going along and approaching Damascus
column5: suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.

column4: He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him
column5: "Saul
column6: Saul
column7: why do you persecute me?"

column4: He asked
column5: "Who are you
column6: Lord?" The reply came
column7: "I am Jesus

column4: But get up and enter the city
column5: and you will be told what you are to do."

column4: The men who were traveling with him stood speechless because they heard the voice but saw no one.
Saul got up from the ground
column5: and though his eyes were open
column6: he could see nothing; so they led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus.

column4: For three days he was without sight
column5: and neither ate nor drank.

column4: Now there was a disciple in Damascus named Ananias. The Lord said to him in a vision
column5: "Ananias." He answered
column6: "Here I am
column7: Lord."

column4: The Lord said to him
column5: "Get up and go to the street called Straight
column6: and at the house of Judas look for a man of Tarsus named Saul. At this moment he is praying

column4: and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and lay his hands on him so that he might regain his sight."
But Ananias answered
column5: "Lord
column6: I have heard from many about this man
column7: how much evil he has done to your saints in Jerusalem;

column4: and here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who invoke your name."
But the Lord said to him
column5: "Go
column6: for he is an instrument whom I have chosen to bring my name before Gentiles and kings and before the people of Israel;

column4: I myself will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name."
So Ananias went and entered the house. He laid his hands on Saul and said
column5: "Brother Saul
column6: the Lord Jesus
column7: who appeared to you on your way here
column8: has sent me so that you may regain your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit."

column4: And immediately something like scales fell from his eyes
column5: and his sight was restored. Then he got up and was baptized

column4: and after taking some food
column5: he regained his strength. For several days he was with the disciples in Damascus

column4: and immediately he began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues
column5: saying
column6: "He is the Son of God."

column4: All who heard him were amazed and said
column5: "Is not this the man who made havoc in Jerusalem among those who invoked this name? And has he not come here for the purpose of bringing them bound before the chief priests?"

column4: Saul became increasingly more powerful and confounded the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that Jesus was the Messiah.
After some time had passed
column5: the Jews plotted to kill him

column4: but their plot became known to Saul. They were watching the gates day and night so that they might kill him;
but his disciples took him by night and let him down through an opening in the wall
column5: lowering him in a basket.

column4: When he had come to Jerusalem
column5: he attempted to join the disciples; and they were all afraid of him
column6: for they did not believe that he was a disciple.

column4: But Barnabas took him
column5: brought him to the apostles
column6: and described for them how on the road he had seen the Lord
column7: who had spoken to him
column8: and how in Damascus he had spoken boldly in the name of Jesus.

column4: So he went in and out among them in Jerusalem
column5: speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.

column4: He spoke and argued with the Hellenists; but they were attempting to kill him.
When the believers learned of it
column5: they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

column4: Meanwhile the church throughout Judea
column5: Galilee
column6: and Samaria had peace and was built up. Living in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit
column7: it increased in numbers.

column4: Now as Peter went here and there among all the believers
column5: he came down also to the saints living in Lydda.

column4: There he found a man named Aeneas
column5: who had been bedridden for eight years
column6: for he was paralyzed.

column4: Peter said to him
column5: "Aeneas
column6: Jesus Christ heals you; get up and make your bed!" And immediately he got up.

column4: And all the residents of Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
Now in Joppa there was a disciple whose name was Tabitha
column5: which in Greek is Dorcas. She was devoted to good works and acts of charity.

column4: At that time she became ill and died. When they had washed her
column5: they laid her in a room upstairs.

column4: Since Lydda was near Joppa
column5: the disciples
column6: who heard that Peter was there
column7: sent two men to him with the request

column4: So Peter got up and went with them; and when he arrived
column5: they took him to the room upstairs. All the widows stood beside him
column6: weeping and showing tunics and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was with them.

column4: Peter put all of them outside
column5: and then he knelt down and prayed. He turned to the body and said
column6: "Tabitha
column7: get up." Then she opened her eyes

column4: He gave her his hand and helped her up. Then calling the saints and widows
column5: he showed her to be alive.

column4: This became known throughout Joppa
column5: and many believed in the Lord.

column4: Meanwhile he stayed in Joppa for some time with a certain Simon
column5: a tanner.

column4: In Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius
column5: a centurion of the Italian Cohort
column6: as it was called.

column4: He was a devout man who feared God with all his household; he gave alms generously to the people and prayed constantly to God.
One afternoon at about three o'clock he had a vision in which he clearly saw an angel of God coming in and saying to him
column5: "Cornelius."

column4: He stared at him in terror and said
column5: "What is it
column6: Lord?" He answered
column7: "Your prayers and your alms have ascended as a memorial before God.

column4: Now send men to Joppa for a certain Simon who is called Peter;
he is lodging with Simon
column5: a tanner
column6: whose house is by the seaside."

column4: When the angel who spoke to him had left
column5: he called two of his slaves and a devout soldier from the ranks of those who served him

column4: and after telling them everything
column5: he sent them to Joppa.

column4: About noon the next day
column5: as they were on their journey and approaching the city
column6: Peter went up on the roof to pray.

column4: He became hungry and wanted something to eat; and while it was being prepared
column5: he fell into a trance.

column4: He saw the heaven opened and something like a large sheet coming down
column5: being lowered to the ground by its four corners.

column4: In it were all kinds of four-footed creatures and reptiles and birds of the air.
Then he heard a voice saying
column5: "Get up
column6: Peter; kill and eat."

column4: But Peter said
column5: "By no means
column6: Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is profane or unclean."

column4: The voice said to him again
column5: a second time
column6: "What God has made clean
column7: you must not call profane."

column4: This happened three times
column5: and the thing was suddenly taken up to heaven.

column4: Now while Peter was greatly puzzled about what to make of the vision that he had seen
column5: suddenly the men sent by Cornelius appeared. They were asking for Simon's house and were standing by the gate.

column4: They called out to ask whether Simon
column5: who was called Peter
column6: was staying there.

column4: While Peter was still thinking about the vision
column5: the Spirit said to him
column6: "Look
column7: three men are searching for you.

column4: Now get up
column5: go down
column6: and go with them without hesitation; for I have sent them."

column4: So Peter went down to the men and said
column5: "I am the one you are looking for; what is the reason for your coming?"

column4: They answered
column5: "Cornelius
column6: a centurion
column7: an upright and God-fearing man
column8: who is well spoken of by the whole Jewish nation
column9: was directed by a holy angel to send for you to come to his house and to hear what you have to say."

column4: So Peter invited them in and gave them lodging. The next day he got up and went with them
column5: and some of the believers from Joppa accompanied him.

column4: The following day they came to Caesarea. Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
On Peter's arrival Cornelius met him
column5: and falling at his feet
column6: worshiped him.

column4: But Peter made him get up
column5: saying
column6: "Stand up; I am only a mortal."

column4: And as he talked with him
column5: he went in and found that many had assembled;

column4: and he said to them
column5: "You yourselves know that it is unlawful for a Jew to associate with or to visit a Gentile; but God has shown me that I should not call anyone profane or unclean.

column4: So when I was sent for
column5: I came without objection. Now may I ask why you sent for me?"

column4: Cornelius replied
column5: "Four days ago at this very hour
column6: at three o'clock
column7: I was praying in my house when suddenly a man in dazzling clothes stood before me.

column4: He said
column5: 'Cornelius
column6: your prayer has been heard and your alms have been remembered before God.

column4: Send therefore to Joppa and ask for Simon
column5: who is called Peter; he is staying in the home of Simon
column6: a tanner
column7: by the sea.'

column4: Therefore I sent for you immediately
column5: and you have been kind enough to come. So now all of us are here in the presence of God to listen to all that the Lord has commanded you to say."

column4: Then Peter began to speak to them: "I truly understand that God shows no partiality
but in every nation anyone who fears him and does what is right is acceptable to him.
You know the message he sent to the people of Israel
column5: preaching peace by Jesus Christ-- he is Lord of all.

column4: That message spread throughout Judea
column5: beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John announced:

column4: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power; how he went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil
column5: for God was with him.

column4: We are witnesses to all that he did both in Judea and in Jerusalem. They put him to death by hanging him on a tree;
but God raised him on the third day and allowed him to appear
not to all the people but to us who were chosen by God as witnesses
column5: and who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.

column4: He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one ordained by God as judge of the living and the dead.
All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name."
While Peter was still speaking
column5: the Holy Spirit fell upon all who heard the word.

column4: The circumcised believers who had come with Peter were astounded that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles
for they heard them speaking in tongues and extolling God. Then Peter said
"Can anyone withhold the water for baptizing these people who have received the Holy Spirit just as we have?"
So he ordered them to be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they invited him to stay for several days.
Now the apostles and the believers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also accepted the word of God.
So when Peter went up to Jerusalem
column5: the circumcised believers criticized him

column4: saying
column5: "Why did you go to uncircumcised men and eat with them?"

column4: Then Peter began to explain it to them
column5: step by step
column6: saying

column4: "I was in the city of Joppa praying
column5: and in a trance I saw a vision. There was something like a large sheet coming down from heaven
column6: being lowered by its four corners; and it came close to me.

column4: As I looked at it closely I saw four-footed animals
column5: beasts of prey
column6: reptiles
column7: and birds of the air.

column4: I also heard a voice saying to me
column5: 'Get up
column6: Peter; kill and eat.'

column4: But I replied
column5: 'By no means
column6: Lord; for nothing profane or unclean has ever entered my mouth.'

column4: But a second time the voice answered from heaven
column5: 'What God has made clean
column6: you must not call profane.'

column4: This happened three times; then everything was pulled up again to heaven.
At that very moment three men
column5: sent to me from Caesarea
column6: arrived at the house where we were.

column4: The Spirit told me to go with them and not to make a distinction between them and us. These six brothers also accompanied me
column5: and we entered the man's house.

column4: He told us how he had seen the angel standing in his house and saying
column5: 'Send to Joppa and bring Simon
column6: who is called Peter;

column4: he will give you a message by which you and your entire household will be saved.'
And as I began to speak
column5: the Holy Spirit fell upon them just as it had upon us at the beginning.

column4: And I remembered the word of the Lord
column5: how he had said
column6: 'John baptized with water
column7: but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.'

column4: If then God gave them the same gift that he gave us when we believed in the Lord Jesus Christ
column5: who was I that I could hinder God?"

column4: When they heard this
column5: they were silenced. And they praised God
column6: saying
column7: "Then God has given even to the Gentiles the repentance that leads to life."

column4: Now those who were scattered because of the persecution that took place over Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia
column5: Cyprus
column6: and Antioch
column7: and they spoke the word to no one except Jews.

column4: But among them were some men of Cyprus and Cyrene who
column5: on coming to Antioch
column6: spoke to the Hellenists also
column7: proclaiming the Lord Jesus.

column4: The hand of the Lord was with them
column5: and a great number became believers and turned to the Lord.

column4: News of this came to the ears of the church in Jerusalem
column5: and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.

column4: When he came and saw the grace of God
column5: he rejoiced
column6: and he exhorted them all to remain faithful to the Lord with steadfast devotion;

column4: for he was a good man
column5: full of the Holy Spirit and of faith. And a great many people were brought to the Lord.

column4: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul
and when he had found him
column5: he brought him to Antioch. So it was that for an entire year they met with the church and taught a great many people
column6: and it was in Antioch that the disciples were first called "Christians."

column4: At that time prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
One of them named Agabus stood up and predicted by the Spirit that there would be a severe famine over all the world; and this took place during the reign of Claudius.
The disciples determined that according to their ability
column5: each would send relief to the believers living in Judea;

column4: this they did
column5: sending it to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.

column4: About that time King Herod laid violent hands upon some who belonged to the church.
He had James
column5: the brother of John
column6: killed with the sword.

column4: After he saw that it pleased the Jews
column5: he proceeded to arrest Peter also. (This was during the festival of Unleavened Bread.)

column4: When he had seized him
column5: he put him in prison and handed him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him
column6: intending to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

column4: While Peter was kept in prison
column5: the church prayed fervently to God for him.

column4: The very night before Herod was going to bring him out
column5: Peter
column6: bound with two chains
column7: was sleeping between two soldiers
column8: while guards in front of the door were keeping watch over the prison.

column4: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He tapped Peter on the side and woke him
column5: saying
column6: "Get up quickly." And the chains fell off his wrists.

column4: The angel said to him
column5: "Fasten your belt and put on your sandals." He did so. Then he said to him
column6: "Wrap your cloak around you and follow me."

column4: Peter went out and followed him; he did not realize that what was happening with the angel's help was real; he thought he was seeing a vision.
After they had passed the first and the second guard
column5: they came before the iron gate leading into the city. It opened for them of its own accord
column6: and they went outside and walked along a lane
column7: when suddenly the angel left him.

column4: Then Peter came to himself and said
column5: "Now I am sure that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hands of Herod and from all that the Jewish people were expecting."

column4: As soon as he realized this
column5: he went to the house of Mary
column6: the mother of John whose other name was Mark
column7: where many had gathered and were praying.

column4: When he knocked at the outer gate
column5: a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

column4: On recognizing Peter's voice
column5: she was so overjoyed that
column6: instead of opening the gate
column7: she ran in and announced that Peter was standing at the gate.

column4: They said to her
column5: "You are out of your mind!" But she insisted that it was so. They said
column6: "It is his angel."

column4: Meanwhile Peter continued knocking; and when they opened the gate
column5: they saw him and were amazed.

column4: He motioned to them with his hand to be silent
column5: and described for them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. And he added
column6: "Tell this to James and to the believers." Then he left and went to another place.

column4: When morning came
column5: there was no small commotion among the soldiers over what had become of Peter.

column4: When Herod had searched for him and could not find him
column5: he examined the guards and ordered them to be put to death. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there.

column4: Now Herod was angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon. So they came to him in a body; and after winning over Blastus
column5: the king's chamberlain
column6: they asked for a reconciliation
column7: because their country depended on the king's country for food.

column4: On an appointed day Herod put on his royal robes
column5: took his seat on the platform
column6: and delivered a public address to them.

column4: The people kept shouting
column5: "The voice of a god
column6: and not of a mortal!"

column4: And immediately
column5: because he had not given the glory to God
column6: an angel of the Lord struck him down
column7: and he was eaten by worms and died.

column4: But the word of God continued to advance and gain adherents.
Then after completing their mission Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem and brought with them John
column5: whose other name was Mark.

column4: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas
column5: Simeon who was called Niger
column6: Lucius of Cyrene
column7: Manaen a member of the court of Herod the ruler

column4: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting
column5: the Holy Spirit said
column6: "Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them."

column4: Then after fasting and praying they laid their hands on them and sent them off.
So
column5: being sent out by the Holy Spirit
column6: they went down to Seleucia; and from there they sailed to Cyprus.

column4: When they arrived at Salamis
column5: they proclaimed the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John also to assist them.

column4: When they had gone through the whole island as far as Paphos
column5: they met a certain magician
column6: a Jewish false prophet
column7: named Bar-Jesus.

column4: He was with the proconsul
column5: Sergius Paulus
column6: an intelligent man
column7: who summoned Barnabas and Saul and wanted to hear the word of God.

column4: But the magician Elymas (for that is the translation of his name) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul away from the faith.
But Saul
column5: also known as Paul
column6: filled with the Holy Spirit
column7: looked intently at him

column4: and said
column5: "You son of the devil
column6: you enemy of all righteousness
column7: full of all deceit and villainy
column8: will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord?

column6: saying
column7: "Brothers
column8: if you have any word of exhortation for the people

column4: When he had removed him

column6: 'I have found David

column4: "My brothers

column5: their children

column5: after he had served the purpose of God in his own generation
column6: died

Beware

column4: 'Look

column5: and stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas

column4: So they shook the dust off their feet in protest against them

column4: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.

column5: speaking boldly for the Lord

column4: But the residents of the city were divided; some sided with the Jews
column5: and some with the apostles.

column5: looking at him intently and seeing that he had faith to be healed

column4: When the crowds saw what Paul had done

column4: Barnabas they called Zeus

column4: The priest of Zeus

column6: shouting

column4: In past generations he allowed all the nations to follow their own ways;

column5: where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work that they had completed.

column5: Peter stood up and said to them

column5: we believe that we will be saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus

column4: The whole assembly kept silence

column4: After they finished speaking

column5: for generations past

column5: they rejoiced at the exhortation.

column5: the believers commending him to the grace of the Lord.

column5: having been forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

column5: "Come over to Macedonia and help us."

column4: When he had seen the vision
column5: we immediately tried to cross over to Macedonia

column4: We set sail from Troas and took a straight course to Samothrace

column5: which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia and a Roman colony. We remained in this city for some days.

column7: "If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord

column4: One day

column5: she would cry out

column5: very much annoyed

column4: When they had brought them before the magistrates
column5: they said
column6: "These men are disturbing our city; they are Jews

column4: and are advocating customs that are not lawful for us as Romans to adopt or observe."
The crowd joined in attacking them

column4: After they had given them a severe flogging

column4: Following these instructions
column5: he put them in the innermost cell and fastened their feet in the stocks.

column4: Suddenly there was an earthquake

column5: "Do not harm yourself
column6: for we are all here."

column4: The jailer called for lights
column5: and rushing in
column6: he fell down trembling before Paul and Silas.

column5: "Sirs

column4: They answered
column5: "Believe on the Lord Jesus

column4: They spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all who were in his house.

When morning came
column5: the magistrates sent the police
column6: saying
column7: "Let those men go."

column4: And the jailer reported the message to Paul
column5: saying
column6: "The magistrates sent word to let you go; therefore come out now and go in peace."

column4: But Paul replied
column5: "They have beaten us in public
column6: uncondemned
column7: men who are Roman citizens

column4: The police reported these words to the magistrates

column5: they departed.

column4: After Paul and Silas had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia

column6: where there was a synagogue of the Jews.

column4: And Paul went in
column5: as was his custom

column5: and saying
column6: "This is the Messiah

column4: But the Jews became jealous
column5: and with the help of some ruffians in the marketplaces they formed a mob and set the city in an uproar. While they were searching for Paul and Silas to bring them out to the assembly
column6: they attacked Jason's house.

column5: they dragged Jason and some believers before the city authorities
column6: shouting
column7: "These people who have been turning the world upside down have come here also

column4: and Jason has entertained them as guests. They are all acting contrary to the decrees of the emperor

and after they had taken bail from Jason and the others

column4: That very night the believers sent Paul and Silas off to Beroea; and when they arrived
column5: they went to the Jewish synagogue.

column4: These Jews were more receptive than those in Thessalonica

column4: Many of them therefore believed
column5: including not a few Greek women and men of high standing.
